en: A Bill : Appropriating a certain sum of money to defray the expense of holding a treaty with the Indians claiming lands in the State to Tennessee, 1798 Jan. 26

This document is a bill enacted by the Senate and the House of Representatives of the United States of America on January 26, 1798. In the bill, Congress allocates no more than 25,880.00 to be used to pay all costs of any treaty or treaties held with the Indians that claim land in the state of Tennessee. The bill also states that the 25,880.00 will be paid out of money in the Treasury of the United States that is not appropriated elsewhere.
United States. Congress. House. Committee on Appropriations

none: A Bill : Appropriating a certain sum of money to defray the expense of holding a treaty with the Indians claiming lands in the State to Tennessee, 1798 Jan. 26 : page 1

body.value: 26th January, 1798, Read the first and second time, and committed to a Committee of the whole House, immediately. A Bill Appropriating a certain sum of money to defray the expense of holding a treaty with the Indians claiming lands in the state of Tennessee . 1 Sec. Section 1. Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the 2 United States of America , in Congress assembled, That a sum not ex- 3 ceeding twenty-five thousand, eight hundred and eighty dollars, be appro- 4 priated to defray the expense of any treaty or treaties which the President 5 of the United States may deem expedient to hold with the Indians claim- 6 ing land in the state of Tennessee . 1 Sec. Section 2. And be it further enacted, That the sum aforesaid shall be paid 2 out of any monies in the Treasury of the United States not otherwise ap- 3 propriated.
